sect2.title: Platform Improvements
sect2.para: In addition to user-visible improvements, GNOME &version; includes a number of improvements to the underlying platform that should be appreciated by developers building applications on top of GNOME's powerful framework.

sect3.title: GStreamer
sect3.para: The GStreamer multimedia framework is gradually maturing, and is now used by several applications, such as Sound Juicer, Rhythmbox, Totem, and Marlin.

Improvements in GNOME &version; include:
Support for the ALSA sounds drivers used in Linux kernel 2.6.
Support for more formats, and better support for existing formats, including MP3, Ogg/Vorbis, FLAC, Wave, and mod.
Improved error notification.
Error messages are now translated, so applications can report problems in the user's own language.
